Class Timer

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.Timer
public class Timer extends Object
Represents a simple countdown timer for the game

The Timer class tracks remaining time in seconds using a JavaFX IntegerProperty, allowing it to be bound directly to UI components (e.g., Label) for automatic updated when the timer changes

Provides methods to start, tick (decrement), and reset the timer

    Property
    Description

    seconds

  • Property Details

    • seconds

      public javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty secondsProperty
      Returns the seconds property

      This property can be bound to UI elements to reflect countdown changes automatically

      See Also:
      • secondsProperty()

  • Constructor Details

    • Timer

      public Timer()
      Creates a new Timer instance with the countdown initialized to zero

  • Method Details

    • secondsProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty secondsProperty()
      Returns the seconds property

      This property can be bound to UI elements to reflect countdown changes automatically

      Returns:
      the IntegerProperty representing the remaining seconds

    • start

      public void start(int startSeconds)
      Starts the timer with the given number of seconds
      Parameters:
      startSeconds - the initial countdown value in seconds

    • tick

      public void tick()
      Decrements the timer by one second if greater than zero

      This method should be called periodically (e.g., once per second) to update the countdown

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the timer to zero
